intro: Faroa alata, commonly known as the winged faroa, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive wing-like structures on its leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom throughout the dry season. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Faroa alata thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
